oai_dc:dc.dc:title: The University of Georgia's Mobile Field Investigational Vehcile
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Troutt, H. Fred
Mercer, J. T.
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: In December, 1974, in order to support various instructional missions, especially those related to food producing animal medicine, the College of Veterinary Medicine of the University of Georgia acquired a motor home type vehicle. This vehicle, suitably equipped, served as a mobile laboratory and was primarily employed in the implementation of various herd health and consultative-medicine programs conducted by the Department of Large Animal Medicine and Surgery. The following describes the physical characteristics of the unit and how it was employed.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 1975; 99
